Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_sample_info

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_info sets the sample starting address, type, and playback rate from the fields in the specified AILSOUNDINFO structure.

S32 AIL_set_3D_sample_info(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  AILSOUNDINFO const * const *info
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle whose address and length are to be set.
info
is a structure that contains format and address information about a RAW sample.

Returns

Non-zero if the data is successfully loaded, zero if the image could not be deciphered.

Discussion

This call is identical to the AIL_set_3D_sample_file function, only it can accept RAW data (that is described by the info parameter)..

This function only takes uncompressed data files, so you must use AIL_decompress_ADPCM or AIL_decompress_ASI to decompress the data before calling this function. This function also only takes mono data, so you must use AIL_process_digital_audio to convert stereo files, if necessary.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C


Group: 3D Digital Audio Services
Related Functions: AIL_allocate_3D_sample_handle, AIL_decompress_ADPCM, AIL_decompress_ASI, AIL_process_digital_audio, AIL_set_3D_sample_file
Related Basic Types: H3DSAMPLE, S32
Related Structures: AILSOUNDINFO
Related FAQs: How can I play stereo or compressed digital files with the 3D API?, How do I play a 3D digital sound?
